body_html:
I double checked the code and this still seems impossible. The registry is always retrieved via RegistryName(), and this properly initializes on first use:

  Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>* RegistryName() {    \
    static Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>* registry = \
        new Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>();         \
    return registry;                                                         \
  } \

I also checked the constructor of Registry and it doesn't actually call anything that could lead to a cycle (and in any case the backtrace is not consistent with that).

body:
I double checked the code and this still seems impossible. The registry is always retrieved via `RegistryName()`, and this properly initializes on first use:

```
  Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>* RegistryName() {    \
    static Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>* registry = \
        new Registry<SrcType, PtrType<ObjectType>, __VA_ARGS__>();         \
    return registry;                                                         \
  } \
```

I also checked the constructor of Registry and it doesn't actually call anything that could lead to a cycle (and in any case the backtrace is not consistent with that).
